executive_summary.title: Executive Summary
executive_summary.note: Add the Executive Summary PDF here.

items.title: Informational Ontology (Master & Condensed)
items.blurb: Establishes the foundational ontology and regime structure, deriving higher-order phenomena from minimal ontological commitments.

items.title: Resolution Under Degeneracy
items.blurb: Examines how systems continue when constraints underdetermine immediate transitions.

items.title: Systems, Boundaries, and Re-Identifiability
items.blurb: Develops a structural account of identity and persistence across change.

items.title: Constraint, Ordering, and Direction
items.blurb: Develops a structural account of ordering and directional asymmetry in constrained systems.

items.title: Perspective-Induced Openness
items.blurb: Explores structural underdetermination in embedded agents within deterministic systems.

items.title: Agency, Salience, and Free Will
items.blurb: Examines agency in terms of structural underdetermination rather than metaphysical will.

items.title: Meaning Without Semantics
items.blurb: Develops a non-semantic account of meaning grounded in value and organization.

items.title: Logic as a Regime, Not a Foundation
items.blurb: Examines logic as an emergent stabilizing practice within meaning-bearing systems.

items.title: Ethics as Emergent Constraint Regimes
items.blurb: Develops a structural account of ethics as a coordination phenomenon among purposive systems.

items.title: Responsibility, Law, and Moral Practice
items.blurb: Examines responsibility and accountability as functions of available underdetermination.

items.title: Informational Ontology and AI Alignment
items.blurb: Explores AI alignment through structural compatibility rather than value specification.

items.title: Saturation and Sovereignty (Addiction)
items.blurb: Examines addiction as a structural narrowing of available action space.

items.title: Markets as Multi-Agent Stabilizers
items.blurb: Develops a structural account of markets as coordination regimes.

items.title: Can AI Participate in Philosophical Method?
items.blurb: Reflects on the human–AI co-construction of the corpus as a methodological case study.
